data.mission: Validate reproducibility, correctness, and completeness of all delivered materials: run provided notebooks and scripts, verify that all referenced figures and tables exist, check that citations are resolvable, and run a set of sanity tests on numeric results. Produce an issues list and ensure the final report addresses high-severity issues.
Enforce an artifact gate: no cycle completes unless at least one new/updated file is written to /outputs/ (e.g., update roadmap_v1.md + coverage_matrix + references.bib in the next cycle).
Add the 'Ship Every Cycle' rule explicitly to /outputs/eval_loop.md and define what counts as 'shipping' (e.g., 1 completed source note OR 5 BibTeX entries OR 1 coverage-matrix update).

In /outputs/roadmap_v1.md, define 'comprehensive (v1)' as concrete numeric targets per domain (e.g., X textbooks, Y survey papers, Z seminal papers, N open problems) and allocate them across 20 cycles.
